This leaf is healthy, no need Medicine

As a reminder, the diagnosis in this application is only an initial diagnosis. You can follow the advice above but please note that if the disease is too severe it would be better to consult an expert directly.

Potato leaf disease dry spot (early blight) has initial symptoms with dry spots on the lower leaves, brown in color in the form of a typical circular mark centered (like a ring) on the spot, sporulation does not appear like white dew. Dry spot disease (alternaria solani) is a disease of potatoes caused by the fungus Alternaria Solani.

One of the major diseases affecting potatoes is late blight,` caused by the pathogen Phytopthora infestans (Mont.) de Bary; Order Pythiales; Family Pythiaceae. The host range of the pathogen P. infestans includes tomato, potato, bell pepper, eggplant, chili and other solanaceae families. Many stages of the P. infestans life cycle can only be seen under a microscope. Fine threads (mycelium) can be easily observed with a microscope, these threads are characterized by the presence of plasma flow in the cells. The mycelium develops between the cells and cell ends of the hypa thread and is dichotomous. Mycelia propagate on the surface of pure media.
